Topic.Title: On taxes, all that matters is effective tax rates. There nev really WAS a 90% tax rate from that view.

Message.Msg: Apparently delucks can't read and doesn't understand marginal versus effective tax rates. Marginal rates are a meaningless political description, while effective rates are an economic/accounting measure of reality. There has never been a measurably large group of 90% taxpayers, or 70% for that matter. Get a dictionary and educate yourself, dude.

Message.Title: connecticut's new gun laws
Message.Msg: -creates a new "ammunition eligibility certificate," -imposes immediate universal background checks for all firearms sales, -extends the state's assault weapons ban to 100 new types of firearms and requires that a weapon have only one of several features in order to be banned. -newly banned weapons could no longer be bought or sold in Connecticut, -those legally owned already would have to be registered with the state, just like the high-capacity magazines. But hey, Connecticut is pro-2nd amendment.

Topic.Title: You have the RIGHT to have as large a clip and as many rounds loaded as you want on PRIVATE PRORERTY

Message.Msg: So tell us how big brother would enforce a law to see how big ammunition clips are and how many rounds are loaded. What interest does the government have in a registered gun on private property? If someone broke into a house in NYS(NY law now allows up to 10 rd clips again but they cant be loaded past 7 rounds)... and it took the owner of the property 16 rounds out of a 17 round clip to stop the intruder.... what interest (right) does the government have in arresting the legal gun owner protecting his and his family's lives because of the size of a magazine and how many rounds were loaded? Do you really believe the NY law would survive an appeal in the above hypothetical scenario? Some Glocks hold 19 rounds... a homeowner in Texas would be able to protect his family and house... the NYer would no be able to legally do so... is the NYer being afforded equal protection under the constitution? And dipsheet... I would even agree that the govt can limit the # of rounds in a gun when a "carry" permit is required

Message.Title: STARTUP CEO: Here's Why I'm Moving My Company From A State With Low Taxes To California
Message.Msg: (so much for mr "oops" Perry....) STARTUP CEO: Here's Why I'm Moving My Company From A State With Low Taxes To California .... to achieve their goal of building the world's first affordable personal robot, they had to be on the West Coast. "We have to find experienced roboticists, and that really only exists in a few places in the world, and California is one of them." The California advantage is not limited to robots. Many startups crave the engineering talent pool coming out of places like Stanford, he said. And for tech, the Valley is still where the money is.

Topic.Title: STARTUP CEO: Here's Why I'm Moving My Company From A State With Low Taxes To California

Message.Msg: I owned shares in a well known sporting goods company. They left California some years ago for many reasons. Went to Post Falls, ID. They are happy as clams and made enough money to increase book value considerably. They bought me out for 42 times what I had in my remaing shares. I had previously sold about a quarter of my holdings plus many dividends over the years. I was also able to buy their products at a large discount for gifts to family and friends. They left CA. and never looked back. You saw where Stockton has declared BK? There will be others and possibly the whole state. Rots of Ruck as they say in Tokyo.

Message.Title: Time to Raise Taxes on Rich : Ben Stein,conservative & republican
Message.Msg: more and more pubs are taking their heads out of their read ends. The sudden light must be refreshing. and btw, he includes incomes above $250K and supported Obama's plan to tax incomes above that. and also he gets it that lower taxes for the rich do not help the economy or increase production: INGRAHAM: No, no -- do you -- do you not agree that when you tax the rich you ultimately end up over time reducing much of the revenues that would come in for their spending that they make, their hiring and companies where they hire. I mean, a lot of this also is small business owners. STEIN: No, I don't agree with that. I -- I don't agree with you, with all due respect. STEIN: You are a woman of -- well you're a woman of extraordinary intelligence but the data is very clear that we had higher rates of economic growth in the 40s, 50s, 60s and 70s when we had higher taxes. The era of very low Bush 43 taxes has correlated with a low period in productivity growth and a low period of economic growth. You cannot correlate low taxes with high productivity. It just can't be done.

Topic.Title: Time to Raise Taxes on Rich : Ben Stein,conservative & republican

Message.Msg: another obama accomplishment: North Korea vows to resume building nuclear weapons From ASSOCIATED PRESS Last Updated: 10:13 AM, April 2, 2013 Posted: 9:24 AM, April 2, 2013 SEOUL, South Korea — North Korea said Tuesday it will escalate production of nuclear weapons material, including restarting a long-shuttered plutonium reactor, in what outsiders see as Pyongyang's latest attempt to extract US concessions by raising fears of war. A spokesman for the North's General Department of Atomic Energy said scientists will quickly begin work "readjusting and restarting" a uranium enrichment plant and a graphite-moderated, 5-megawatt reactor that could produce a bomb's worth of plutonium each year. Experts considered the uranium announcement to be a public declaration from Pyongyang that it will make highly enriched uranium that could be used for bomb fuel.
